message: Thanks to a friend in Montreal, I've discovered a new-to-me scotch: Ardbeg. It's now my #1 favorite, and yes, that means Lagavulin is now #2! http://desmond.yfrog.com/Himg616/scaled.php?tn=0&server=616&filename=m3eep.jpg&xsize=640&ysize=640

http://www.nytimes.com/2008/12/03/dining/03wine.html?pagewanted=1&_r=1  If you can find a The Balvenie Signature Batch 001 12 Years Old 86 Proof you might like it also. It that Ardbeg, being an Islay Scotch very peaty?
yes, it's the peatiest I've ever had. tastes like a campfire. in a good way. i will keep my eyes open for that balvenie signature!
One of my winter favs is Lagavulin Scotch Single Malt 16 Yr.  Is it more peaty than that?
I'm about half way through a bottle of Lagavulin 16 "distiller's edition"! Yes, Ardbeg is peatier, but not a ton more. There are some other taste differences too, of course.

http://www.whisky-online.com/macallan-1974-25-year-old-anniversary-malt-70cl-43-vol-distillery-bottling.html We just finished off one of these at Christmas. It was like the death of a dear old friend.  Extraordinary!  They used to go for around $225.  You'd be lucky to find one for $1000 now.  If you ever get a chance to try a dram of this bottling don't pass it up.
Wow, awesome! I'd love to try that sometime... I'm going to Montreal next week, and my friend there has a pretty big collection.. maybe I'll get lucky.
Also, I had some of this last night... pretty nice, and a nice change from mega-peatyness: http://desmond.yfrog.com/Himg614/scaled.php?tn=0&server=614&filename=57a9.jpg&xsize=640&ysize=640

Wow, if the colors in the picture are true that is a very golden colored Scotch. Looks similar to The Macallan Fine Oak 21 Years Old my son gave me. http://www.themacallan.com/the-range/fine-oak.aspx?r=true#/expression/fine-oak-21-years-old/2/ If you're flying through Minneapolis stop over for a sample.
Wow, cut this with a knife! http://www.grandwinecellar.com/sku16387.html?utm_source=Google%20Products&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Ardbeg%20Supernova%20SN2010
whoa, awesome! I'll have to try to get some...
Went to the "Whisky Cafe" in Montreal today. They have menu of scotch that is as thick as a phone book. Insane.
I tried some Ardbeg 1977. Was pretty good, though not much different from regular Ardbeg
I shall try to take photos of their menu if I return
